update.description:
This is an attempt to integrate the Pose publisher and the multicopter systems to SubT. The Pose publisher currently publishes the absolute poses of models and the relative poses of links and sensors. This is fed into TF to allow ROS nodes access various transforms without the need for joint_state_publisher and robot_state_publisher.

The Multicoptor system is only added for the X3 for now. It is using the roll-pitch-yawrate-thrust controller from rotorS. Odometry for the controller is provided by the ukf_localization_node which fuses IMU data.

To test:
In one terminal, run
`ign launch subt/subt_ign/competition.ign`

In another terminal, run
`ign launch subt/subt_ign/team.ign`

This is currently setup to start a teleop node assuming the PS3 controller is used. You can use rviz with `subt_example/config/team.rviz` to visualize all the vehicles.

Requires:

* [ign-gazebo PR #322](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/322/blueprint-multicopter-motor-model/diff)
* ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo
update.title: Multicoptor integration

content.raw: I think this and other models should be hardcoded to `https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X2 Config 1` and teams can use this file as a template to choose different configs
content.html: I think this and other models should be hardcoded to https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X2 Config 1 and teams can use this file as a template to choose different configs

content.raw: I confirm that `X4` works for me. Note that the Logitech keypad doesn’t make it fly anymore, however the PS3 controller does.

content.raw: Yeah. `subt_communication_broker_ign` depends on those packages so colcon will fail if those packages haven't been built yet.
content.html: Yeah. subt_communication_broker_ign depends on those packages so colcon will fail if those packages haven't been built yet.

content.raw: I think this makes sure the packages build in the right order if you have ignition and subt in the same colcon workspace
content.html: I think this makes sure the packages build in the right order if you have ignition and subt in the same colcon workspace

content.raw: Just curious, which tool is picking these up?
content.html: Just curious, which tool is picking these up?

@scpeters pointed out that this would require changing the sdformat source code which is a bit risky before the release.

@chapulina found this workaround that forces installation of sdformat8-sdf over sdformat6-sdf:

sudo apt-get -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-overwrite" install sdformat8-sdf

content.raw: I just ran into this issue when trying to setup subt on another machine. So currently the only way users can build subt is to also build sdformat8 and the ign packages that depend on sdformat right? Could the `sdformat-sdf` vs `sdformat8-sdf` conflict be addressed on the deb level?
content.html: I just ran into this issue when trying to setup subt on another machine. So currently the only way users can build subt is to also build sdformat8 and the ign packages that depend on sdformat right? Could the sdformat-sdf vs sdformat8-sdf conflict be addressed on the deb level?

update.title: [WIP] Multicoptor integration

content.raw:
ok, I removed the sdformat8 debs, but installed the other blueprint debs alongside `ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo`

I'm now building a workspace with sdformat8, physics, sensors, gazebo and launch (everything else from debs)
content.html:
ok, I removed the sdformat8 debs, but installed the other blueprint debs alongside ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo

I'm now building a workspace with sdformat8, physics, sensors, gazebo and launch (everything else from debs)

content.raw: Yes, I'm building sdf8 all ignition packages from source.
content.html: Yes, I'm building sdf8 all ignition packages from source.

content.raw: are you building sdf8 from source in the colcon workspace?
content.html: are you building sdf8 from source in the colcon workspace?

content.raw: I'm having trouble installing libsdformat6-dev alongside libsdformat8-dev, more specifically because `sdformat8-sdf` and `sdformat-sdf` appear to conflict
content.html: I'm having trouble installing libsdformat6-dev alongside libsdformat8-dev, more specifically because sdformat8-sdf and sdformat-sdf appear to conflict
